page.title: 08Haverfordwest Castle,Museum
page.content: The castle was built on top of a rocky headland overlooking the river, at an unknown date early in the 12th century. The present building dates from the 13th century with a few later additions. The castle today gives a good indication of the original site. The ground falls away steeply to the east down to the river and gives a commanding position in the town. To the south, stepped banks lead down to the car park, which may have been the site of a moat. the building which houses the museum and record office dates from 18th and 19th centuries and was used as the County Prison before modernisation. The Castle fell into disuse about 1532 and was partially destroyed on the orders of Cromwell in 1648.
